author: Chicago Tribune staff
title: 4 injured, including 15-year-old girl, in South Side shootings - Chicago Tribune
text:
Four people were injured in shootings Sunday on the South Side, Chicago police said.
In the latest shooting at 2:50 p.m., a 15-year-old girl and a 20-year-old man were injured in a shooting on the 6800 block of South Maplewood Avenue in the Marquette Park neighborhood, said Officer Bari Lemmon, a police spokeswoman.
The girl was shot in the back and was taken to Advocate Christ Medical Center, where her condition had stabilized, Lemmon said. The man was shot in the leg and was hospitalized in good condition, Lemmon said. The man is a known gang member, police said.
At 2:13 p.m. a 20-year-old man was shot on the 4700 block of South Calumet Avenue in the Bronzeville neighborhood, said Officer Nicole Trainor, a police spokeswoman. The man was shot in the left calf and was taken to the University of Chicago hospital where his condition had stabilized.
According to police the man was on the street when a dark blue mini-van drove up to him and someone from inside began shooting at him before fleeing in an unknown direction, Trainor said.
Earlier, at 11:20 p.m., a 22-year-old woman was shot in the 6300 block of South Martin Luther King Drive in the Parkway Gardens neighborhood, Lemmon said. Her condition had stabilized.
The woman was shot in the back and managed to get herself to the University of Chicago medical center and was later transferred to Mount Sinai, Lemmon said.
